intro: Bonniera appendiculata, commonly known as the narrowleaf bonniera, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. It features opposite, narrow leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in the summer. Bonniera appendiculata is often found in the understory of forests and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
